name: Residenza del Duca Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as part of our Honeymoon in Italy becuase of the reviews on this site and we weren't disappointed! Our room was lovely and big and very clean and the hotel owners were really friendly and helpful. The breakfast was fresh and plentiful and the coffee was excellent. The minor downside was that we didn't really have a terrace - just a window that opened up onto another building. However, there was a room located next to the breakfast room which had a huge terrace and looked amazing. I guess this was the suite so make sure you book this if you can! This is a fabulous place and I would like to go back one day.
reviews.title: Re: Brilliant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Residenza del Duca is a Jem of a place. My partner and I really struggled to find any faults with the rooms or the service we received from Daniela and Andrea. My only minor critiscim would be the choice available at breakfast but this was more than outweighed by the great conversations we had with a wonderful family from Basingstoke. If you aren't put off by the steps, book this hotel - You won't be disapponited!
reviews.title: A very special hotel

likes.liked: — The quality of the finish in the rooms and the fantastic service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this small family run apartment style hotel in Amalfi for a week in October 2007 and it was superb. Our hosts were incredibly friendly and helpful, the rooms were modern, clean and well appointed. The ocean glimpses from the balcony were nice and the continental breakfast included in the price was very good. It is on the top floor so be prepared to haul your cases up lots of stairs, or ask for assistance. It is very centrally located in town near the main piazza and a short walk to the bus/ferry terminals. It is rather well hidden, but the locals are very friendly and helpful. The nearby cafe and Risto's restaurant with its hand made pasta were excellent. This was one of the highlights of our month in Italy and we highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made another return visit to the Residenza del Duca in November - would not stay anywhere else. Have visited Amalfi regularly for 20 years and stayed in many hotels but now return to the del Duca 2-3 times each year because it is the best!. Daniela, Andrea and their father are the most hospitable hosts. This is a small B+B but with a BIG heart. Spotlessly clean, rooms with wonderful views, superb breakfast (especially the cappuccini) and hosts who are most helpful. A 'breath of fresh air' in a town which has become very busy.
reviews.title: Superb small hotel in Amalfi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Nice Hotel at a good price

likes.liked: — Location right by the Duomo, clean and spacious.
likes.disliked: — Many stairs to get to top floor and no lift

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a short trip to Italy, which included 3 nights at Residenza del Duca Hotel and were thoroughly impressed.
reviews.title: Perfect
Enjoyed breakfast on the balcony!
reviews.text: As the other reviewers have said, it's perfectly located, the rooms are beautiful, clean and modern, breakfast delicious, balconies charming, staff lovely - and the best bit: it's great value - we paid 80euros/night through venere.com
I can't recommend the hotel more.
reviews.title: The hidden gem of Amalfi

likes.disliked: — Many stairs to climb before reaching the 3rd floor where the hotel is, but once you are there it becomes a good exercise! Not a big dissapointment for us so to say... We are still young.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Residenza del Duca for 2 nights in October. The hotel (it is more of a hotel than B&B) is perfectly situated near the main square, but just off a side street so you get the benefits of location, without the noise! The rooms were spacious, wonderfully light and tastefully decorated. The bathroom was small but not the smallest we have come across in Italy.
reviews.title: What a lovely, friendly hotel

likes.liked: — friendliness of staff and standard of room

reviews.text: During our 4 weeks in Italy, Residence Del Duca was the stand-out accommodation. Daniela, Andreas and their dad Gerardo were welcoming and helpful and the room we occupied for 9 nights was a real delight. Location and outlook were terrific, and the 80 steps worth every breath! (see YouTube for the climb). Our room was immaculately presented, tastefully decorated with a spacious ensuite and multi-function massage shower - great after a day's walking. A bonus was the large terrace with its comfy table and chairs and sun lounges which we made full use of. All this over-looked the Piazza dei Dogi and Cathedral spire with ocean glimpses to the south-west. The majestic Torre dello Ziro is also clearly visible. The main street, bus stop and beach are all very close to the hotel.
reviews.title: Memorable, welcoming stay in captivating Amalfi

reviews.text: A vase of Asian lillies appeared in our room one day, after Daniela had been to the market and this was typical of the hospitality. We loved the freshly brewed coffee at breakfast and freshly picked tomatoes and greens appeared one morning from the dad's own garden.
reviews.title: Very disapointed

reviews.text: Residence del Duca is a wonderful boutique hotel in a fascinating area of Italy.
reviews.title: A lovely room and a warm welcome await at the top of the 70 stairs

reviews.text: Booked this hotel in Feb/March for 2 rooms for 3 nights.
reviews.title: Loved it!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was done directly with Daniela over 4 e-mails back and forth. Rooms were confirmed and credit card details given for guarantee.
reviews.title: A fabulous hotel

likes.disliked: — The stairs, they are a challenge....but worth it

description: Small and friendly family hotel in the historical centre of Amalfi a touch away from the bus-station, the harbour and the beaches.
